ygData.subject: More revisions
ygData.msgSnippet: I m almost through taking my new team (1 elf, 1 barbarian, 1 fire elemental, and 2 clerics) through my scenarios (only have the last 3 left.) Boy, has it been

Subject: More revisions
Message-ID: <b9q494+97vl@...>
User-Agent: eGroups-EW/0.82
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1
Content-Length: 2108
X-Mailer: Yahoo Groups Message Poster
From: "Daniel Paul Hightower" <dph_of_rules@...>
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=62491402
X-Yahoo-Profile: dph_of_rules

I'm almost through taking my new team (1 elf, 1 barbarian, 1 fire 
elemental, and 2 clerics) through my scenarios (only have the last 3 
left.)

Boy, has it been challenging and I decided some more revisions are in 
order for my set.  I found one scenario without a link to the next 
one.  I decided to upgrade the doors of "Master Slime" (#158) and also 
add lots more blood to the scenario so that clerics can raise more 
skeletons.  It's amazing how my team wants to attack the slime in 
"Master Slime", but had to be dragged in attacking the slime in "The 
Slime King" (#156).  I decided to help give those archers a fighting 
chance in "The Port City" (#124) and I may do more work on the golem 
so it has a fighting chance on its own instead of being a liability.

My elf had a big coming out party during my hedge scenarios (117, 120, 
121, 122) :-) .  I was really thrilled about how well my team handled 
"The Escaped Prisoners" (#157) and "the Castle Defenses" (#159) :-) . 
 I was suprised how the NPC help had more mana and health available 
than some of my team members with higher experience levels.

I'm relieved that my team surived "Battle of the Gods" (#162) without 
getting hurt (I was worried they'd open the doors and clear the 
forest quickly enough to fight in the battle).  Good thing I put all 
those blood spots around.  At the same time, I admit being scared of 
"the End of Extreme Island".  [I'm not worried at all about the last 
two.]

You guys are wrong, there were a couple of scenarios I completed in my 
set without any teammates gaining an experience level.  It was quite 
interesting earning enough money to buy a level 40 character after 
beating a scenario.

I'm slightly concerned that right now, it's impossible for my 
barbarian to use up his mana, while the rest of my team has potential 
problems with having enough mana.  I'm still upset about his aiming 
system. (Why in the heck does the barbarian have such a bad tendacy to 
aim both hurl boulder and exploding boulder incorrectly when firing 
straight, but achieves perfect accuracy when aiming diagonally?)
